intro: Babiana cedarbergensis, commonly known as the Cedarberg babiana, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its bulbs are adapted for storing water and nutrients, allowing it to survive in arid conditions. It is often found in the Cedarberg region of the Western Cape, where it contributes to the local biodiversity.
